titleInfo.title: Models of Puryear Mims’ statues at the Tennessee State Capitol, 1958 October 28

mods.identifier: RG 3 1427 statues by Puryear Mims Oct28 1958 005

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured from left to right: Puryear Mims? and Nashville Mayor Ben West standing below the art models made of either wood or plaster of paris of the statues designed by Thomas Puryear Mims, depicting “The Founding of Nashville” pioneers James Robertson and John Donelson, on display at the State Capitol, October 28th, 1958. Sculptor Thomas Puryear Mims (1906-1975) taught art at Vanderbilt University and in 1958 was appointed Sculptor in Residence. Mims created numerous public sculptures around Nashville. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission. Please contact the Metro Archives, Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219. Telephone (615) 862-5880.
